title.en: Intellectual Property Protection in the Field of Information Technology

faculty.address:

Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

type.en: Course with defence at the end
Course with defence at the end
Course with defence at the end

description.en:
The course covers:

1. Copyright law vis-a-vis ICT
1.1. Basic principles of copyright in information society (incl. legal protection of software and databases)
1.2. Use of rights (e.g. free use, Digital Rights Management)
1.3. Use of copyrighted works (e.g. pursuant to law, contract, Creative Commons); non-free and free software licenses (BSD, GPL, MIT);

2. Industrial Property
2.1. Basic principles of the legal regimes of trademarks, patents, designs and domain names in relation to information society;

3. Enforcement of Intellectual Property Rights in the Information Age
3.1. Practical insight to litigation in IP-IT law;
3.2. Case law of national, as well as International courts or other bodies (e.g. ECJ)

4. Future of IP and IT law 
4.1.  successes and failures of rights management and enforcement etc.

objectives.en: The purpose of this course is to give a thorough overview of the legal and practical aspects of intellectual property related to IT, analyze the relevant legal issues related to Internet and communication and information technology, and analyze the influence of technology and legal rules.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on anda põhjalik ülevaade IT-ga seotud intellektuaalomandi õigusest ja praktikast de lege lata ja de lege ferenda alusel; uurida Interneti, kommunikatsiooni- ja infotehnoloogia tekitatud õiguslikke probleeme; käsitleda infoühiskonnas tekkivate õiguslike ja tehnoloogiliste reeglite vastastikust mõju.

learning_outcomes.en: * know the main legal concepts of intellectual property;
* will be familiar with the relevant law applicable to IT related IP;
learning_outcomes.et: * tunneb IT valdkonna intellektuaalomandiga seotud õigust;

learning_outcomes.en: * have necessary skills to assess the legal status of IT related intellectual property problem and is able to apply them;
learning_outcomes.et: * on omandanud IT-ga seotud probleemide õigusliku hindamise oskused ja suudab neid rakendada;

learning_outcomes.en: * be able to analyze and solve IT related intellectual property problems; apply these solutions and create legal strategies solo and in team and present arguments orally.
learning_outcomes.et: * on võimeline IT-ga seotud intellektuaalomandi probleeme analüüsima, neile lahendusi leidma ja rakendama ning õiguslikke strateegiaid looma nii üksi kui tiimina ning argumenteerima eeltoodut suuliselt.

independent_work.et:
Seminars:
- Copyright seminars: participants will submit a compulsory study;
- Industrial property seminars: participants will submit a study or take a test.
Copyright homework submission deadline: TBA
Industrial Property homework submission deadline: TBA.

Moot Court:
- The participants will be divided in three groups as Applicant, Defendant, Panel; preparation of written submission by Applicant and Defendant and written decision by the Panel;
Homework submission deadline for applicants & defendants: TBA.
Homework submission deadline for judges: TBA.
- Presentation of the submissions, rebuttal, answering court's questions.

All homeworks must be submitted in Moodle.

grade_preconditions.et:
All homework assignments are done on the level of "E".
Moot Court Submission/decision is submitted and done on the level of "E".
Oral presentation at the Moot Court is done on the level of "E".

debt_elimination.et: Based on an agreement with the lecturers at least 1 week before the division of participants into the groups of Applicant, Defendant, Panel for the Moot Court assignment

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
